bibl.title: Territory of Washington vs. George Smith
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Fourth Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington SS County of Spokane In Justice Trust before J.R. Snyder, Justice
Transcripts of proceedings lately had before J.R. Snyder a Justice of the Peace in and for Spokane County, Washington believes the Territory of Washington. Plaintiff and George Smith Defendant.
Territory of Washington Plaintiff vs. George Smith Defendant

Be it Remembered, that on this 2nd day of June 1888. Charles D. Colwell files complaint on oath charging that on that on this 1st day of June 1888 at the County aforesaid George Smith did unlawfully and feloniously steal take and carry away one valise and contents consisting of clothing

and wearing appearal of the value of Seventy Five dollars. The property of and belonging to the said Charles D. Colwell He prays that the said George Smith may be arrested and dealt with according to law. June 2nd 1888. Warrant issued and delivered to J.F. Warren, Chief of Police for serving. June 2nd 1888. Warrant returned by officer Warren executed by arresting the said George Smith and bringing him before said Justices for examination. Complaint read to defendant and he pleads not guilty and is ready for trial. He having been advised as to what his legal rights were. It is ordered that this case be continued at the request of plaintiff until 10 o'clock A.M. on this day to procure witnesses Subpoena issued for Charles Colwell C.M. Graves and F.L. Graves on the part of the Territory. June 2nd 1888 at the hour of

10 o'clock A.M. this case cause on for trial. Charles D. Colwell, C.M. Graves and F.L. Graves were sworn and examined on the part of the Territory. George Smith was sworn and examined on the part of the defendant the evidence being closed. It appearing from the evidence that a crisis has been committed, and there is probable cause to believe that the defendant is guilty as charged in the complaint. Therefore it is considered ordered and adjudged that the defendant George Smith be required to recognize with give sureties in the sum of Five Hundred Dollars to be and appear at the District Court of Washington Territory, to the 4th Judicial District Now holding Court at Spokane Falls the County seals of said District and the witnesses on the part of the Territory are required to recognize in the sum of one
